intro: Chapelliera arthrophylla, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky soils and dry environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are small, linear, and covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. Chapelliera arthrophylla is also known for its ability to survive in extreme temperatures and low moisture conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
